intro: Logania longifolia var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved logania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are shorter and more compact compared to the typical variety, giving it a distinct appearance. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
